pros: Feels like you’re a part of a family, great work culture despite hard times with covid pandemic. Pay is great as well.

review_title: Caring supportive management, good team spirit
job_title: Senior Speech Pathologist in Harris, NY
pros: Human Resources were there for me when I had complex visa requirements to meet. I was impressed by the way management engendered a strong team spirit through the first wave of COVID, with clear lines of communication for the many necessary and continuing changes to keep staff and patients safe. It was great to be part of a forward moving team.
cons: It would have been good if a way could have been found for speech pathologists to work more closely together across the main two hospitals, beyond telephone conferences to agree changes to documentation.
Hospital is old, dirty, lead in water, computers are slow, high nursing turn over, absent leadership, never enough supplies.

pros: Long term need for this type of work
cons: There are not enough trained and qualified personnel .

pros: kind staff, newly renovated. i am so happy here
cons: rude patients are the worst part

pros: Salary, benefits, atmosphere, overall good place to work
cons: Union Representation tends to take management side instead of advise and assist their members

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Harris, NY
pros: Community vibe, friendly staff, great pay
cons: small hospital, not a lot of different units to work on

review_title: Newly renovated hospital, staff is friendly and there is a community feel because of the size.
pros: Administration is always a stone's throw away and you really feel like you get to know them because it's a small hospital. However, because of it's close ties with ORMC, an RN still has some of the newest and most efficient equipment to work with.
cons: Staffing is oftentimes inadequate. Charge nurses take on the same patient load as any staff nurse so they are not able to be of real assistance when situations arise. Nursing assistants are few and overworked which leads to loss of joy.

pros: Plenty of overtime if you want it
cons: Employees are very rude/mean! and management doesn't care about your health at all! they want you to come in if you are sick with the flu or any other health issues! you would think being in the hospital they would want you healthy around sick patients with low immune systems! They don't listen to your concerns ever! ALOT OF BULLYING! and ALOTTTT OF MANDATION! they say its rotated but that is a lie!. They also don't ever want you to move up! if you tell them you are going to or want to go to school to be a nurse they will get MAD at you and say they will NOT work with your schedule.

job_title: Registered Medical Assistant in Monticello, NY
pros: Really great atmosphere and people to work with.
cons: The days can be very long and during the peak season you can work 14 hours or more.

pros: Union, most co-workers are decent, pay is ok for area
